Pre-Game Insights: Argentina enters the semifinals with high expectations as they seek to secure back-to-back Copa America titles.
Led by Lionel Messi, who has taken on a more supportive role in this tournament, Argentina boasts a formidable attacking lineup.
Lautaro Martinez has emerged as the tournament’s leading scorer with four goals, while Alexis Mac Allister has contributed two assists.
Despite a somewhat shaky performance against Ecuador, where they needed a penalty shootout to advance, Argentina remains the heavy favorite.
Canada has been the surprise package of this Copa America. Under the guidance of new head coach Jesse Marsch, they have exceeded expectations, making it to the semifinals for the first time.
Despite losing 2-0 to Argentina in the tournament’s opening match, Canada has shown resilience and growth, particularly in their defensive organization.
Their Cinderella run, marked by a dramatic penalty shootout win over Venezuela, has captivated fans and set the stage for a historic semifinal.
